SEARCH
Package antcolony.data

Class WorldTime

java.lang.Object
antcolony.data.WorldTime
public class WorldTime extends Object
Simulation time manager.

This class converts continuous time (ticks) into readable calendar units (Days, Hours, Minutes, Seasons). It is responsible for notifying colony statistics when a new day begins.

      public float worldTime
      Global elapsed time counter (in ticks). This value increments continuously with every frame.

      Current season index (0 to 3).

    • dayProgress

      public float dayProgress
      Completion percentage of the current day (0.0f to 1.0f). Useful for color interpolation (day/night cycle).

    • seasonProgress

      public float seasonProgress
      Completion percentage of the current season (0.0f to 1.0f). Useful for visual transitions between seasons.

  • Method Details

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the simulation time to the initial state (Day 1, 00:00).

    • tick

      public void tick(float amount)
      Advances the simulation clock.
      Parameters:
      amount - Amount of time to add (affected by the speed slider).

    • recalc

      public void recalc(ColonyStats statsA, ColonyStats statsB)
      Recalculates calendar variables based on total elapsed time.

      This method converts the accumulated `worldTime` into days, hours, and minutes. It also checks if the day has changed since the last frame and, if so, triggers the daily statistics wrap-up for the colonies.

      Parameters:
      statsA - Blue Colony statistics (for end-of-day notification).
      statsB - Red Colony statistics (for end-of-day notification).
